definition: to feel/to move/to touch/to affect/feeling/emotion/(suffix) sense of ~
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with

sentences.english: On carrying our his experiment, Faraday discovered electromagnetic induction.
sentences.chinese: 在進行實驗時，法拉第發現了電磁感應現象。

sentences.english: The rangeability of magnetic induction effect enhance after annealing.
sentences.chinese: 退火可以提高非晶薄帶的磁感應效應變化幅度。

sentences.english: Faraday was the scientist who discovered electromagnetic induction.
sentences.chinese: 法拉第是發現電磁感應的科學家。

sentences.english: Inverse problem of the open magnetic induction tomography.
sentences.chinese: 開放式磁感應成像逆問題研究。

sentences.english: The magnetic induction intensity of the fibers raised with increasing of thickness of the fiber.
sentences.chinese: 隨着樣品厚度的增加纖維的磁感應強度明顯加大。

sentences.english: The residual magnetism that remains on magnetic storage media after degaussing .
sentences.chinese: 經消磁後，磁介質上殘留的磁感應。

sentences.english: The sensing itself is done by magnetising a spot on the rim of the flywheel.
sentences.chinese: 感應過程通過磁感應調速輪邊緣的一個點來實現。

sentences.english: Dice in a magnetic induction block contact, can throw the various points.
sentences.chinese: 色子在磁感應塊上接觸一下，可擲出各種點數。

sentences.english: Magnetic induction of a circular current is calculated using magnetic scalar potential.
sentences.chinese: 用磁標勢法計算了圓形線電流的磁感應強度。

sentences.english: Compact, high magnetic induction intensity and long coil service life.
sentences.chinese: 結構緊湊，磁感應強度高，線圈使用壽命長。

sentences.english: Exchange the silicon controlled rectifier to control, electromagnetic induction exports.
sentences.chinese: 交流可控硅控制，電磁感應輸出。

sentences.english: Electromagnetically induced transparency and slow light in ultracold Bose gas were investigated.
sentences.chinese: 研究了超冷玻色氣體中的電磁感應透明現象。

sentences.english: The electromagnetically induced two-photon transparency (EITT) under the control of coherent field is investigated.
sentences.chinese: 研究了相干場控制下的電磁感應雙光子光透明。

sentences.english: While the relative error hardly changes if magnetic induction strength increases to some value.
sentences.chinese: 當磁感應強度增加到一定值時，其誤差幾乎不變。
